duties_responsibilities.duty: Handle legal matters and provide counsel to the Oswego County Department of Social Services.
Represent the Department at all Family Court appearances & trials.
Prepare Department staff to give testimony and review legal documents and actions.

Provide legal advice in connection with various social services programs including all aspects of Child Welfare, Adult Protective Services, Medicaid, Temporary Assistance and Child Support Establishment/Enforcement.

education_certification.credential: Graduation from an American Bar Association accredited law school, admission to the NYS Bar, and one (1) year of experience, or its part-time equivalent, in the practice of social services law, or closely related field. Special Requirement: NYS license to practice law. Current registration with the NYS Office of Court Administration at time of appointment.
